resources.name: OTEC Seawater Cooling 20C Depth Profile - Summer Average

title: Ocean Thermal Energy Conversion (OTEC) | Seawater Cooling - Depth Profile 20u00baC (Summer Average)
name: ocean-thermal-energy-conversion-otec-seawater-cooling-depth-profile-20c-summer-average-49711
notes: This shapefile represents the seasonal summer depth profile to reach water at a temperature of 20u00baC.rnrnSea water cooling can be used for industrial or residential cooling needs where heat must be rejected. A typical resource for direct air-conditioning applications is no warmer than 8u00baC, which has been established as a minimum value of interest for this study. Water at temperatures between 8u00baC and 20u00baC can be used to supplement air conditioning processes, or to reject heat from many other low temperature industrial processes. Water temperatures above 20u00baC were not considered for this investigation as cost savings begin to break down as sea water temperature nears ambient temperatures. Depth profiles for three water temperatures of interest: 8u00baC, 14u00baC and 20u00baC were established to aid selection of optimal sites for sea water cooling. A cool shallow resource just off the coast where a need may exist presents significant opportunity for energy and cost savings.rnrnData were processed and converted to shapefile format by NREL for the [Ocean Thermal Extractable Energy Visualization](http://www.osti.gov/bridge/purl.cover.jsp?purl=/1055457/1055457.pdf)rnrn### License InfornThis GIS data was developed by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (
